intro: Malvastrum tenuifolium, commonly known as slenderleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
